organization.$: Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology

head.citation-title: Hydrotalcite-supported platinum nanoparticles prepared by a green synthesis method for selective oxidation of glycerol in water using molecular oxygen
head.abstracts: Hydrotalcite-supported platinum nanoparticles (Pt NPs/HT) prepared by the immobilization method with soluble starch as a reducing and a stabilizing agent were applied as catalysts for the selective oxidation of glycerol using atmospheric molecular oxygen as an oxidant in water. The Pt NPs/HT catalyst achieved a high selectivity (68%) toward glyceric acid (GA) in base-free aqueous solution. The catalyst was removed from the solution by simple filtration after the reaction and could be reused up to three times with a high selectivity (71% in third recycled). © 2012 American Chemical Society.

organization.$: Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology

The catalyst was removed from the solution by simple filtration after the reaction and could be reused up to three times with a high selectivity (71% in third recycled). © 2012 American Chemical Society.
